definition: premeditated/to plan sth in advance (esp. a crime)

sentences.english: Organised crime continues to be the perpetual scourge of Milanese civic life.
sentences.chinese: 有預謀的犯罪仍然是對米蘭市民的永遠的威脅。

sentences.english: Now he was charged with premeditated murdering, Steenkamp's shooting death valentine's day.
sentences.chinese: 現在皮斯托瑞斯被指控在情人節預謀槍殺斯廷坎普。

sentences.english: The destruction of Maldek was premeditated.
sentences.chinese: 摧毀馬爾戴克是有預謀的。

sentences.english: Differences in state law include differences in interpretation of premeditation . In some states .
sentences.chinese: 各州法律的不同還表現在對預謀策劃的理解也不同。

sentences.english: Preparation (Subtlety) no longer refreshes the cooldown of Premeditation .
sentences.chinese: 預備現在不再重置預謀。

sentences.english: This case is typically a cold-blooded murder.
sentences.chinese: 該案是一個典型的預謀殺人案。

sentences.english: This was clearly a premeditated attempt to silence opposition voices.
sentences.chinese: 這顯然是有預謀的壓制反對派聲音的企圖。

sentences.english: We do not think the deceptions were premeditated , however.
sentences.chinese: 但是，我們不認爲這場欺騙是預謀好的。

sentences.english: There is a world of difference between simple human error and premeditated malevolence.
sentences.chinese: 有一個世界的區別簡單的人爲錯誤和有預謀的惡意。

sentences.english: It suggests premeditation and epic willfulness, codified as inherited instinct.
sentences.chinese: 它使人想到形成遺傳本能的預謀和史詩般的固執。

sentences.english: At times, it seemed the wind and rain were conspiring against him, so were the drivers.
sentences.chinese: 風和雨有時候似乎預謀好來和他作對，駕車人也如此。

sentences.english: And they were under the influence of a strong media campaign, well-organized.
sentences.chinese: 他們受到有組織有預謀的媒體陣營的影響。

sentences.english: Premeditation will now be pre-reqd by Preperation.
sentences.chinese: 現在預謀需要預備天賦作爲其前置。

sentences.english: Malice on the part of all participants is implied from the dangerousness of the robbery itself;
sentences.chinese: 參與者的預謀是由搶劫本身的危險性所暗示出來的。

sentences.english: This battle emperor in the sky premeditates already a long time, how may give up.
sentences.chinese: 這場戰役天帝預謀已久，怎麼可能放棄。

definition: to accuse/to denounce/to make a complaint against/denunciation
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
to watch a play/to watch passively (i.e. from the sidelines, from the crowd)
to disturb/to cause a commotion/to harass
fuse (for explosives)/(fig.) proximate cause/the last straw
